channel.title: What tablet should I get?
channel.description: Well I would never buy a tablet but I recently found that all of my college textbooks can be bought (pirated) as ebooks. So I contacted my teachers and they said they do not care if its hardcover or ebook as long as I read the assigned material. So basically what tablet should I buy for this purpose, I dont want to get some cheapo tablet JUST for this purpose, I also want something that is decently powerful and will allow me to do other things such as being able to remote desktop, word processing, watching 1080p video. Anyone know of a tablet that will perform these tasks well? I was thinking of just getting an iPad as the benchmarks have shown that it is even faster than the Asus Transformer Prime, but I see that they may be releasing another one soon so what should I do?

item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

They have an adapter that allows you to connect an SD card into it, but it’s purpose is for importing photos (straight from a camera). Apple were never one for removable storage in their handheld devices unfortunately. Like previously said, they prefer to just make different capacity versions (16, 32, 64GB).

[quote=“the bank, post:18, topic:427935”][quote author=Niall link=topic=530623.msg3904534#msg3904534 date=1328096357]

Apple will never add a card slot. The reason they won’t is because if they do, they have no reason to sell a 16, 32 and 64GB version of most of their products. Perhaps the costs of a 32 over a 16GB iPad is more than just a bigger memory card, but I bet they get a shitload of profit just from selling a product with more storage capacity. I wouldn’t call it a scam, but it’s close.

if they don’t offer removable media and sell differing size models then it is a scam, plain and simple
[/quote]This, but that’s just Apple for you. Same with their stupid proprietary port for the USB charger/docking.[/quote]

That’s annoying too. I mean, you’ll always have a phone or other device that comes with a normal mini-usb wall charger, which can be used with all your other devices. Of course, Apple decided to make cash cows out of their customers.

item.description:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:12, topic:427935”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=530623.msg3878106#msg3878106 date=1325804979]

How about a real ebook reader? The screens on tablets aren’t very pleasant at all for reading, whereas a Kindle (for example) causes no strain whatsoever.

I agree. I have a Sony PRS-650, and I love it. But there is a downside, pdf files aren’t resizable the way epubs are. So you have to convert them, which means the lay-out turns out wrong.

If reading ebooks is all you want to do, you should buy a good ereader and a really cheap tablet for pdf’s.

Well I take fights almost weekly so it would be a big upside not to carry a laptop along when i could just use an ipad on plane for movies and ipad+keyboard for work. Only downside is I doubt apple is going to be adding a microsd slot anytime soon. I may still go with one of the asus transformers havent fully made up my mind yet.

[/quote]
